website_summaries.verdict: According to those who have used it, the Yokota 2 is a lightweight shoe that offers a generous amount of comfort and traction. Its airy upper is also a hit to those looking to hike in warm weather. On the other hand, the footgear’s lack of cushioning may be a cause of concern for some. All in all, the Merrell Yokota 2 may still be an outstanding pair for day hikers, granted buyers can look past its issues.
pros: Loads of buyers agree that the Merrell Yokota 2’s comfort level is off the charts
According to numerous consumer reviews, it is a delightfully lightweight hiking shoe
A majority of users say this Merrell offering supplies sufficient grip when tackling wet and dry terrain
The shoe’s breathability astounds a bunch of outdoor enthusiasts
A handful of adventurers find the Yokota 2’s break-in period to be non-existent
A minority of purchasers state that it gives a lot of value for its affordable price
cons: Several owners declare the Merrell Yokota 2’s cushioning to be insufficient
Its arch support fails to impress some outdoorsy individuals
A sole shopper says that the shoe’s pull loop at the back ripped off after a few uses

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the version 1
customer_reviews.text: Like a lot of companies Merrell has outsourced their manufacturing and their product quality has suffered. These are okay but they feel like they are just a smidge small compared to the previous version of which I wore out three pairs. So they have gone from shoes that feel like they are already broken in right out of the box to okay but you are going to have to get used to them. Time to start looking at Keen or some other alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: G. Robinette

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't going to buy any more Merrell shoes because of lesser quality on recent purchases. These were a good price and my old pair of Merrells are worn so I purchased another pair. So far so good. They fit ok. Maybe a little smaller than expected especially the left shoe. I've worn them half dozen times so far and pleased with how they feel. Typically takes several months to break them in then they last another year or so. Four out of five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: VERY happy with my purchase. Perfect fit, Great Quality (of course, they're Merrells)
customer_reviews.text: I bought my first pair of Merrell work boots about 7 years ago and I have never gone back to another brand. I have never had a brand of foot ware hold up to my abuse like Merrell. I get at least 2 years out of my work boots where I was getting less than 1 with other brands. I wear 11.5 work boots and the 11.5 sneakers I ordered fit perfectly, very comfortable right out of the box. I am very happy with my sneakers and will continue to order Merrells in 11.5 online and hopefully never EVER go to a shoe store again. Would recommend this brand to EVERYONE
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Good quality , good price.
customer_reviews.text: For the price I think the Merrell brand is hard to beat. I have tried several others and I think these are as good as any lightweight hikers. Roomy toe box for a normal or D width. I wear moisture wicking wool blend socks when hiking so these work well. If you have a narrow foot they may be somewhat wide.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Fine shoes, wish there was more cushioning
customer_reviews.text: I have relatively flat feet. The contours inside don't really support my feet quite right but I can still wear them all day in decent comfort. They are snug in the ankle and roomy in the toes. The balls of my feet get a little raw after walking or standing for a while as there isn't much cushioning there. The fabric is quite breathable; I can feel the wind go through these more than other pairs of shoes I've owned.
customer_reviews.author: Chiepler

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes I bought bigger size than I usually wear.
customer_reviews.text: these shoes look very nice and relatively comfortable. The soles are very soft and it feels like you walk on some nice and soft surface. I usually wear 44EU size and first I bought 10.5 size and they were small for me so I bought 11.5 which should be like 45EU size and they fit me perfect. Not sure how long they will last they look kind of too soft like snickers and no foot support at all.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Awesome hiking shoes
customer_reviews.text: The fit and feel is great. Arch support feels awesome. I had Plantar Fasciitis a couple of years ago and healed it by switching to shoes with good arch support. These feel great and would benefit anyone with that problem. I did read a lot of reviews though and ordered a half size larger than my size. So these do run a half size small.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C.

customer_reviews.title: The most durable, and comfortable shoe
customer_reviews.text: I've owned Merrell's in the past, and in the beginning, it was a stretch to spend $100.00 or more on shoes unless they were a work boot, but after years of wear and tear on my previous Merrell's,. I'm happy to spend a little more on a quality shoe. I'm a fairly large man who loves the outdoors, and hiking, biking, and even urban trekking. I had some pain in my left foot, and when I'm wearing my new Merrell's, I dont feel the pain like with my other shoes, I'm completely happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey L. Cox

customer_reviews.title: Great foot support!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves Merrill foot beds and these are especially light and comfortable. He is a sales trainer and travels across US & Canada. Lots of time on his feet in airports and in front of groups and at trade shows on hard surfaces. These shoes keep him going and are nice looking so look fine with Dockers and polos. Great shoe for work & play!
customer_reviews.author: Roseanne Haglin

customer_reviews.title: Quality issues already
customer_reviews.text: There are loose threads on the outer toe on one shoe after a couple days of wear. Not sure how long they will hold up. They are comfortable and I like the sole tread.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: I found the arch support on these, and on Merrells in general, to be a little too far back for my foot. They felt a little strange on my feet. Also, they make you feel like you're walking in shoes with heels. They seem like quality shoes, just not what works for me. I had to send them back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable with great arch support
customer_reviews.text: This Merrell style is a very comfortable walking shoe even for those with problem feet. My husband has fibromyalgia that effects just about every joint in his body so finding a light-weight shoe with good arch support is a real challenge. I was so pleased to find a good fit for him that I purchased three pair. Also found them to be a good value compared to the mall shoe stores.
customer_reviews.author: C. Buonomo

customer_reviews.title: Too small fit, and was charged to return. Do not buy. Highly not recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Too small fit, and was charged to return. Do not buy. Highly not recommended. Update: I ordered next size up and STILL too small. I've worn Merrells for years, and something has changed - these are made differently and way, way too small. Very frustrating!
customer_reviews.author: S. Levy

customer_reviews.title: Really nice shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. They actually do fit like a glove. Snug at first, but in a good way. Fit loosens a bit over time, but still very comfortable and supportive. Arch support is the best I have come across. This is my second pair of this style. The first pair lasted well. Very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: T. Homer

customer_reviews.title: VERY NICE!
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my husband. He is a big Merrell fan. He has had plantar fasciitis and says these shoes have helped tremendously with that. They look great too! He liked them so much I bought 2 more pairs for him (different colors).
customer_reviews.author: madhouse

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable hiking shoes
customer_reviews.text: While these shoes didn't fix my plantar fasciitis, they sure feel good. I had originally bought another pair but these shoes stayed in my mind. So I cancelled the other pair & bought this pair. And I am very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Leo Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Yokota 2 = cheap materials
customer_reviews.text: Own two pairs of the original Yokota, is a awesome shoe... Merrell went cheap on Yokota 2, is a lesser quality shoe... Hopefully Merrell puts the quality back on on the "3's"..
customer_reviews.author: Think

customer_reviews.title: Good step down from Chameleon Hex
customer_reviews.text: I usually buy chameleon flex, but these were for work and didn’t want to spend the extra money. These are very comparable to the chameleon flex, largest difference is a traditional tongue and laces. Solid fit to size ordered.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking and walking shoe
customer_reviews.text: These Merrill shoes are great for hiking and walking, and they are really good looking too. They are very comfortable and well made, as all Merrill shoes are. Nice color combo and so easy on the feet.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy J. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Solid lightweight trail shoes
customer_reviews.text: Wanted footwear midway between trail runners and full hiking boots, and these fit the bill nicely. They are lightweight without feeling flimsy. Good sole grip, and they have good lateral stability -- no rolling tendency. The cushioning is minimal, so I added some gel insoles and now they can take me 6-8 miles at a time with no soreness and no blisters. Good investment in happy feet!
customer_reviews.author: Bradford Behr

customer_reviews.title: Much narrower than Moab. At least half size smaller.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered unusual size. I could have returned it for a half or full size larger, but due to width difference compared with the Moab I returned this and chose a different shoe. The wide was not available....Went with the Merrell crosslander 2. The granite color is much more brown than grey!
customer_reviews.author: David Stubbington

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Typical Merrell style and comfort. These are very light and fit well. My only complaint is they don't come with elastic laces but that was resolved with another product on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great pair of shoes. This is the best fitting pair of shoes i've worn in a long time. Good arch mold and fit. Good qualilty. Third pair I've had and they really last. Highly recommend merrell
customer_reviews.author: John B.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair of these brand shoe. The last pair I ordered ran a little small, so I ordered a half size larger this time. They fit great. They seem to hold up well to wear and are comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Hoerning

customer_reviews.title: Buy elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: For $80 shoes they really shouldnt have been clearly used!! There is animal hair on them! My husband is allergic to cats! You can tell someone attempted to clean them up but for that cost receiving used shoes is UNACCEPTABLE! They were needed for a trip we are taking tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for multiple use.
customer_reviews.text: I use it as a dayley shoe. I have two. One for everyday use and one for hickeing. It performs perfectly for both. Easy purchases. Fast and the correct size and color.
customer_reviews.author: marque mccaw

customer_reviews.title: Merrell hiking shoe
customer_reviews.text: The shoes fit great, I have had Merrell shoes in the past and I have always been very satisfied with the quality of the shoes.
customer_reviews.author: J S.

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: I wear an 11 all day and these were really tight. Seems to be of high quality. Just go up in size.
customer_reviews.author: Chris P.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful shoes
customer_reviews.text: Just as always , this brand holds its standards. They always fit great and last a long time!! True to size.
customer_reviews.author: BuddhaTree

customer_reviews.title: Runs way too small
customer_reviews.text: My husband has been buying and wearing Merrill’s for years. He always buys 11.5. These are way too small.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Shabrach

customer_reviews.title: Not true to size
customer_reviews.text: Does not run "true to size". I originally ordered a size 12 as I wear a size 12 in almost every shoe I own. Some I wear 11.5. The 12's were way too small so I've returned them and ordered a size 13. When the 13s arrived they were also too small. I will be sending those back and will not be ordering a size 14. Ridiculous
customer_reviews.author: Tony Ratkiewicz

customer_reviews.title: As per another review, I wear 10.5 and ordered a 11.5 which fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: Merrell's have been my go to shoe for decades. Personally I don't think they are made as well as they used to be. These fit well ordering a full size larger than normal and the color is what the picture shows it is, let's see how they wear.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: comfort
customer_reviews.text: these---as all Merrell shoes, are like walking on sponge. And, they holdup better than anything I've owned.
customer_reviews.author: Gary B.

customer_reviews.title: Never met a pair of Merrells my feet didn't like.
customer_reviews.text: I've never had a pair of Merrells that my feet didn't like.
customer_reviews.author: jen

customer_reviews.title: Fit well but the color is not what I ordered
customer_reviews.text: These fit very well I went a half size larger , The color is wrong ? Didn't order gray ones ? But not a show stopper .I recommend these .
customer_reviews.author: Lisa R. Alderman

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Have been buying these shoes brand for last 8 years. Landscape and where and walk in them 5 days a week. They last
customer_reviews.author: Joan J

customer_reviews.title: Great Florida hiking shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, very comfortable and no “break in” time. My first Merrell’s. Already looking at other styles. Love ‘em!
customer_reviews.author: Aquaman

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: A different model than what was expected and too snug. They will be returned.
customer_reviews.author: Judith P.

customer_reviews.title: Great styling and super comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: These may be the most comfortable hiking/walking shoe I’ve ever owned! The fit is near perfect for my size 14!
customer_reviews.author: BillB

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a good product. I can't give it 5 stars because I haven't had an occasion to see if they are waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes!!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best pairs of shoes I have ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Darin Hiott

customer_reviews.title: Too hot for general trecs in S Fl.
customer_reviews.text: I have toe on left foot that is curved upward Sent to shor repair for stretching. Live my Merrell Barefoots but not enough padding for my disc problem
customer_reviews.author: R. Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable well built shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable well built shoe . I believe it would work well as a hiking shoe, but I use it as daily footwear for an active indoor workplace. I found this to be far superior to sketchers shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Tom from Concord

customer_reviews.title: great shoe
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are super. They fit and are mega comfortable. Because they are Merrill's I'm sure they will last many years.
customer_reviews.author: D. Dolfinger

customer_reviews.title: Love these sneakers
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and my last pair were very durable. Had to buy the same model.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Portnoy

customer_reviews.title: fits small
customer_reviews.text: Love the shoe and brand but I have other Merrill hikers and this one ran small
customer_reviews.author: terry

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and good support
customer_reviews.text: Good support and traction for walking and hiking. Comfortable right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: this guy

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are perfect for range operations and outdoor activities. The only thing I would say is a pain in the rear are the shoe laces.
customer_reviews.author: Happy hunter

customer_reviews.title: I ordered 10 1/2
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a 10 1/2. They sent size 10. Now have to wait till they stretch out some. I love my Merrells, so the last set lasted 8 years hiking, finally wore them out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: Delivery time was our biggest factor and they got it to us before expected. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Dee Ann Graham

customer_reviews.title: Another Great Shoe from Merrell
customer_reviews.text: This shoe fits great, is as light as my other Merrell's I had and hold up very well. I use them daily for work and love them!!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as expected
customer_reviews.text: Tight in the ankle, rubbing creates blisters. Heels are uneven.
customer_reviews.author: Harris R. Ginsberg

customer_reviews.title: They are beasty
customer_reviews.text: I use it for work I work on the roof everyday I luv how they let the air flow thru.....then my feet don't sweat
customer_reviews.author: Menno lengacher

customer_reviews.title: The low version seems sturdy
customer_reviews.text: So far very comfortable, the mid size ones I got also on amazon already has a broken eyelet after 3 days
customer_reviews.author: Alvah Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Love the shoes
customer_reviews.text: Shoes are everything I expected from Merrill. I will wear them everyday for work.
customer_reviews.author: Dino crossville

customer_reviews.title: A very nice casual walking shoe.
customer_reviews.text: The footbed is a bit thinner than other Merrell hikers but is soft and comfortable. It’s a good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Bandi

customer_reviews.title: Run Half size small
customer_reviews.text: The shoe runs about a half size small. Luckily I have a son that the shoe fitted perfectly
customer_reviews.author: Jim Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Check size
customer_reviews.text: I buy number 7,5 and delivery 7 ... very small
customer_reviews.author: Estêvão

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase. The shoes fit nicely and are well constructed.
customer_reviews.author: Gwenisha

product_meta.title: Merrell Men's Yokota 2 Hiking Shoe
product_meta.description: This all-around hiker features suede for durability and abrasion-resistant mesh panels for breathability.
feature_bullets: Suede and textile upper Metal hook and lacing eyelet for secure lacing Bellows tongue keeps debris out Protective rubber toe cap M Select FRESH antimicrobial agents reduces shoe odor Molded TPU heel counter for added stability Breathable mesh lining Kinetic Fit BASE insole is contoured like your foot and provides flexible, intuitive support for connected and protected movement

Molded nylon arch shank Merrell Air Cushion in the heel absorbs shock and adds stability M Select GRIP outsole tunes each outsole with durable traction that grips when and where you need it 4mm Lug Depth Weight: 1lb 1oz / 752g
